rdfs:comment.en-US: A human being regarded as an individual. (Oxford)
An aptitude, capacity or power to act physically, socially, mentally, legally, or morally at a level suitable to the work context;select from an existing enumeration of such types.

vann:usageNote.en-US: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of ability types such as the O*NET cognitive, sensory, psychomotor and physical abilities; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.
Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of contact types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.en-US: Specification of the type of contact point.
Whether or not the attribute being annotated is required.
Type or category of scale or weighting to be applied to a specific competency (knowledge, skill, ability), task, responsibility, interest etc.; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

dct:description.en-US: Where logically applicable, previously defined scales can be applied to a range of previously defined controlled concepts and competencies.

vann:usageNote.en-US: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of scale types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.
Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of work shift types (e.g., HR Open Standards ShiftTypeCodeList.json); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.en-US: Type of the typical work shift of the job.

Tool, application or other form of technology that requires knowledge, skill and ability to use effectively in executing the tasks and responsibilities of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

vann:usageNote.en-US: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of technology types such as O*NET technology and tools; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.en-US: Information about any required travel, systematic or occasional.
Expected date when the employment begins.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of career level types (e.g., HR Open Standards CareerLevelCodeList.json); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: A code classifying the level of a candidate based on career experience; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment term types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of employment term (e.g. regular, temporary, seasonal); select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Base salary of the job or of an employee in an employee role including minimum and maximum salary and unit value (e.g., hour, day, week, month, or year).
The relavant country of the resource. For example, USA.
Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation - specific credential requirements should use required credential.
Resource describing an example assessment.
Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) identifying organizations, persons, states, government agencies, corporations, and companies.
Number of positions open for this job.
The locality; e.g., Mountain View, London, Moscow.
Organization offering the job position.
The median value.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment contract agreements; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of employment agreement (e.g. employee, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship, under collectively bargaining, eligible for overtime); select from an existing enumeration of such types.
The value of the quantitative value or property value node. (node?)

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of types; likely external encounters with encodings in schema:DefinedTermSet, schema:DefinedTerm, W3C's SKOS, CTDL-ASN and ASN.

rdfs:comment.@value: The canonical term identified by the AnnotatedDefinedTerm
Description of the employer, career opportunities and work environment.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use to identify a place using geo coordinates; preferably includes a URI for the location as well as longitude and latitude from a service such as GeoNames (https://www.geonames.org/).

rdfs:comment.@value: Geographic coordinates of a place or event.

vann:usageNote.@value: Used in the context of JDX to assign terms from occupation, industry and instructional program classifications, skills and abilities, and abstract concepts to JDX entities. Through the class' relationship with the jdx:ScaledAnnotation class, terms can be conditioned through applications of scales for attributes such as importance and frequency.

rdfs:comment.@value: A word, name, acronym, phrase, defined in a controlled value space (e.g., taxonomy, glossary, dictionary, tag list, and other forms of enumeration).
Entity providing the means to make logical asserions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.
Description of the area or domain to be assessed.
A description of the item.
The fax number of an organization or person.
International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.
The postal code. For example, 94043.
A contact point—e.g., for information about a job opening or interview.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Description of sensory requirements and levels necessary to function on the job including hearing and vision.
Description of the physical requirements of the job including activities and their associated levels.

dct:description:.@value: The date from which the job posting is valid in ISO 8601 format. For example, "2017-02-24" or "2017-02-24T19:33:17+00:00" (Google) .

rdfs:comment.@value: The date from which the item is not valid.

vann:usageNote.@value: The scale may be applied to any appropriate controlled voabulary concept such as knowledge, skill, and ability as identified in the associated jdx:AnnotationDefinedTerm.

rdfs:comment.@value: A rating or score representing the difficulty of the particular entity to acquire.
Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

vann:usageNote.@value: A posting channel usually would be a job board or other advertising medium (HR).

rdfs:comment.@value: An entity providing information about where and how a posting should be communicated.
Physical address of the entity.

vann:usageNote.@value: Do NOT use jdx:JobMaster in an entity in any public facing resource.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity used internally as rdfs:domain or "master" to which all properties used in JobDescription, JobPosting, and JobCompetencyProfile are applicable.

vann:usageNote.@value: The relevant state, province, territory or other subdivision of a nation state.

rdfs:comment.@value: The region; e.g., CA, TX.
Entity providing qualifying notations including application of scales and other weights to concepts and competencies identified through a jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm.

Entity listing major work tasks, knowledge, skills, and abilities requirements for carrying out those work tasks based on a job analysis that engages subject matter experts in defining and validating the importance, frequency, or other types of weightings of the enumerated competencies.
Entity describing verifiable work, education or training experience supporting a person's qualification to perform the tasks and responsibilities of a position.

vann:usageNote.@value: This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc.

rdfs:comment.@value: A monetary value or range.
Organization or person contact point for the posting.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience types including, but not limited to, "Education Experience", "Training Experience", "Work Experience" and it's subtypes "Apprenticeship" and "Traineeship"; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.
Resource referenced is a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of task types such as O*NET tasks; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: A piece or unit of work to be done or undertaken and accomplished within a defined period of time or by a deadline; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Entity that describes the key characteristics of an assessment administered to candidates for a job.
End date (time) for the posting.
Any special commitments associated with this job posting (e.g. low-income, native American, ex-offenders, military commit) along with any special exclusions (e.g. criminal records).
A code that identifies this DefinedTerm within a DefinedTermSet.
A description of the job location (e.g., TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).

Description of any exposure to risks associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

NOTE: In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels ond locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations; the NAICS industry code applies SOLELY to the location where the work of the job being described will be performed.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed.
Resource provided as assessment rubric for the annotated defined term .
The agent requesting the posting.
Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.
Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.
An indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.
The referenced artifact or performance confirming or supporting an assertion.
Whether or not a particular requirement is expected at the time of hiring or may be subsequently obtained.

Listing of the major work tasks, knowledge, skills, and abilities requirements for carrying out those work tasks based on a job analysis that engages subject matter experts in defining and validating the importance, frequency, or other types of weightings of the enumerated competencies.
The upper value of some characteristic or property.
The currency (e.g., USD) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.
A defined term set that contains this term.
A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.
Summary description of the ideal candidate's qualifications for a position.
The location where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.
Name of department or unit where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.
Degree program of study.
Geographic location(s) in which employees may be located for remote (telecommuting) jobs.
The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of assessment method types such as the HR Open Standards ApprovalStatusCodeList.json; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Values that describe the status of an approval process.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of physical activity types such as "bending", "standing", "sitting"; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

@graph.rdfs:comment: Resource identifying types of physical activity associated with a job.

vann:usageNote.@value: This property has been defined as a super-property for a set of more refined subproperties including knowledge, skills, abilities, attitudes, tasks, and work activities that indicate qualification for the job; encode competencyies using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Observable and measurable knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes that contribute to enhanced employee performance of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. (HR)
Focused plan of study within a college or university degree such as a concentration in Aerospace Engineering within an Engineering degree.
Word or phrase used to refine and describe significant aspects of the entity.
Information on the work languages used for the job. (HR)
The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.
URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
Whether or not the attribute being annotated has been given priority.
Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.
The 75th percentile value.
Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.
Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

An online advertisement for filling one or more job position openings that contains information on the employer and the job position based on a job description as well as how and to apply for the job opening and how long the posting is valid for filling the job opening.
A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary.
Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.
Description of any security clearance requirements.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of attitude types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Motivators of performance including values, aspirations, and priorities necessary to successful performance of a task or job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Entity describing authoritative permission to hold a certain status or to do certain things, e.g. to practice some trade or profession.
Whether or not a requirement in a poosting may be acquired post-hire.

Entity providing a statement of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.
Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.
The telephone number of an organization or person.
The title of the job.
The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment schedule types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of employment schedule (e.g. full-time, part-time, flex-time, shared-time); select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Entity providing instructions for posting a job position opening to a job board or media channel and for submission of applications.
Identifies a resource from which properties of the resource being described were obtained in whole or in part.
The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

vann:usageNote: Use a value selected from a country code list such as the Library of Congress' List of Countries (http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/countries.html).

rdfs:comment.@value: Required country of the applicant's citizenship.

dct:description.@value: (Wikipedia) A skill is the ability to carry out a task with determined results often within a given amount of time, energy, or both.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of skill types such as the O*NET skills; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Ability to apply knowledge and use know-how to complete tasks and solve problems including types or categories of developed proficiency or dexterity in mental operations and physical processes required to fulfill a work role; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Resource referenced provides the means to make logical asserions about alternative conditions.
The identifier for the position that may be used externally in an advertisement.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Category or categories of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

vann:usageNote.@value: Google Jobs recommends using "HOUR", "DAY", "WEEK", "MONTH", "YEAR"; these values also appear in HR Open's PayCycleIntervalCodeList.json

rdfs:comment.@value: Unit of measurement on which employee pay is based such as "hour", "day", "week", "month", "year"; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation.

vann:usageNote.@value: Entity that contains information on the employer and the job position based on a job description as well as how to apply for the job opening and how long the posting is valid.

rdfs:comment.@value: Entity describing an on-line advertisement for filling one or more job openings.
Description of any necessary disclaimers for the posiiton or posting.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience level types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Level of experience required; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Department or unit where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.
The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585.
Statistical distribution of monetary amounts.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of education levels such as ceterms:AudienceLevel or HR Open Standards IscedCodeList.json; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: A word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
A contact point for a person or organization.

Description of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.
Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of activity types such as the O*NET work activities (https://www.onetonline.org/find/descriptor/browse/Work_Activities/); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Purposeful, systematic activity by one or more workers acting on a work objective to reach an intended outcome.
Description of benefits associated with the job (e.g., "employee discount", "health insurance", "401K plan".
Start date (time) for the posting.
The 90th percentile value.
Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.

dct:description:.@value: The date when the job posting will expire in ISO 8601 format. For example, "2017-02-24" or "2017-02-24T19:33:17+00:00" (Google) .

rdfs:comment.@value: The date after when [which?] the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
The name of the item.
The geo coordinates of the place.
The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of credential types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of credential such as badge, certification, bachelor degree; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
Position(s) to which this position reports and over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.
Email address of an organization or person.
Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.

vann:usageNote.@value: Determine datatype encoding for HTML markup in a jsonld literal
The description should support HTML or other markup.

rdfs:comment.@value: Complete representation of the job, including job responsibilities, qualifications, skills, working hours, education requirements, and experience requirements.
The 10th percentile value.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of risk exposure types; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Types or categories of risk exposure associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

dct:description.@value: Frequently treated as an aspect of the notion of "competency" along with skills and abilities.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of knowledge types such as the O*NET knowledge (https://www.onetonline.org/find/descriptor/browse/Knowledge/); encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Body of facts, principles, theories and practices that is related to a field of work or study; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
Narrative instructions for applying for this position.
Closing date for accepting applications.
The lower value of some characteristic or property.
Organization that issued or otherwise provided the resource.
Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.
Resosurce to define assessment criteria and their scoring
A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of assessment method types such as the ceterms:AssessmentMethod vocabulary; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

rdfs:comment.@value: Type of method used to conduct an assessment; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of, if any.
An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

dct:description.@value: The estimated salary is usually computed by outside organizations and therefore the hiring organization is not bound to this estimated salary.

rdfs:comment.@value: Description of the estimated salary for a job posting based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location.

Quantitative value and unit type of the weight, degree, percent, or strength of a recommendation or requirementto a specific competency (knowledge, skill, ability), task, responsibility, interest being annotated.
Assessment of a candidate employees qualifications.
Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.
The date of posting by a channel.
Resource referenced provides the means to make logical asserions about alternative conditions.
The mailing address of an entity.
Key work tasks or activities over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.

vann:usageNote.@value: Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union; encode using the jdx:AnnotatedDefinedTerm entity.

NOTE: In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels ond locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations; the NAICS industry code applies SOLELY to the location where the work of the job being described will be performed.

rdfs:comment.@value: Code for identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed.
The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.
Physical location where job applications can be submitted.
Identifies a job board or media channel associated with a job posting.
Relationship between an organization and a department of that organization.
The 25th percentile value.
Duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

vann:usageNote.@value: Used, for example, when applying an importance scale to a competency identified in an instance of the AnnotatedDefinedTerm class.

rdfs:comment.@value: Resource for identifying and applying a defined scale or rating to another resource.
An associated logo.
An organization such as a corporate body, employer, distribution channel provider.
The language of the content or performance or used in an action.
